title: Edit an enterprise asset
content:
You can edit an enterprise asset record to add new information or change existing information.

You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration > Enterprise Assets.

  2. Select the enterprise asset record you want to edit.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.

  4. By default, the enterprise asset record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view.

    TABS
    Tab Description
    General Displays details of the selected record. For more information, see the General tab section.
    Workflow Displays the workflow metaphase and phase for the selected enterprise asset. For more information about workflows, see Enterprise asset workflow.
    Finance Displays information about acquisition and sale and connection to fixed assets. For more information about finance, see the Finance tab section.
    Related records Displays records that are related to the current record. Currently, it only supports to display Incident and Request related records. The record will be displayed after you link an enterprise asset to a record from the Involved CIs tab.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the current record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.

  5. Save your changes.

General tab

This tab has the following sections. 

Overview

overview section
Field Description
Display label External (common) name of the asset.
Subtype  A level of categorization of the asset. For more information, see Enterprise asset subtypes.
Process type Type of the enterprise asset process, including Full Ownership, Consumable, and Stationary.
Model The asset model. For example, Notebooks. If you update the asset model from a batch model to a non-batch model (or vice versa), the enterprise asset’s Batch, Quantity and UOM values will also change accordingly. When you update the model, a warning message is displayed to remind you of this.
Batch

Whether this asset is managed collectively or individually. If the asset is based on an asset model, the value of this option is determined by the model and read-only.

Available for editing when: The phase of the asset is New, the asset isn't based on an asset model, and the process type is Consumable.
Owner The person who manages or monitors the asset.
Asset tag Asset tag value for the asset.
Location

Physical location of a physical asset. The only stockrooms available for selection are those that are operational (a stockroom is operational when it's in the Operational phase of the workflow).

When the asset is in the In stock phase, this value is read-only, and is automatically populated with the location of the selected stockroom.
Quantity

The number of individual assets that comprise this batch asset. The default value is 1.

Available when: The Batch option is selected.
UOM

The unit of measure of the individual assets in batch assets. 

Available when: The Batch option is selected. If you selected a model that is configured as a batch of items, the UOM is copied from the model but can be edited.

Details

details section
Field Description
Managed externally Service Management checks this box if your organization manages enterprise assets with third-party applications or databases. If Service Asset and Configuration Management manages your enterprise assets, don't check this box.
Missing Select if the enterprise asset is missing.
Description Detailed enterprise asset description.
Global ID A globally unique identifier.
Barcode

Barcode or an RFID tag value.

A barcode is an optical machine-readable representation of data, which shows certain data on certain products.

An RFID tag is incorporated into a product to identify and track using radio waves.
Brand Brand of the asset.
Serial number The manufacturer's assigned serial number or unique ID.
First installation date The date the asset was first installed.
Last inventoried date The last date the asset was inventoried.
Stockroom

The stockroom that stores the asset.

Available when: the asset is in the In stock phase.
Stockroom entry date

The date the asset entered into stock.

Available when: the asset is in the In stock phase.
Reserved

A checked box specifies the asset is reserved. This usually applies to a request workflow.

Available when: the asset is in the In stock phase.
1st level support Level 1 support is the group assigned to support the asset.
2nd level support Level 2 support is the next level of escalation when an issue isn't resolved by the level 1 group.
3rd level support Level 3 support is the final escalation level when an issue isn't resolved by the level 2 group.

Sustainability

Note that this section is only applicable when the carbon footprint calculation feature is enabled.

sustainability section
Field Description
Product lifetime (Year) Expected lifetime of your asset model in years.
Energy demand (TEC, kWh/year) Expected energy consumption for your asset model over a one-year period.
Lifetime usage emissions

Scope 2 carbon emissions generated at the use phase of your asset model.

Basically, Lifetime usage emissions = Energy demand (TEC, kWh/year) * Product lifetime (Year) * Carbon intensity of electricity (kgCO2e/kWh), where the value of  Carbon intensity of electricity (kgCO2e/kWh) is defined in Location. If there are valid values in the three fields, the value of Lifetime usage emissions will be automatically calculated. 
Embodied emissions Scope 3 carbon emissions generated at the manufacturing, transport, and end-of-life phases of your asset model.
Recurring usage emissions Recurring lifetime usage emissions based on emission recurring period. For example, If Emission recurring period = monthly, then Recurring usage emissions = Lifetime usage emissions / Product lifetime (Year) / 12 .
Emission recurring period Recurring period of carbon emissions: Weekly, Monthly, or Yearly.
Total emissions Total carbon emissions of your asset model, including both Lifetime usage emissions (Scope 2) and Embodied emissions (Scope 3).
Unit

Unit of carbon emissions.

Note that only kgCO2e is supported in this release. 

Warranty & maintenance

warranty and maintenance section
Field Description
Default warranty contract The name of the warranty contract for the asset.
Warranty end date The date the warranty for this asset ends. The default value is taken from the end date of the default warranty contract, if any.
Default maintenance contract The name of the maintenance contract for the asset.
Maintenance end date The date the maintenance for this asset ends. The default value is taken from the end date of the default maintenance contract, if any.

Retirement

retirement section
Field Description
Planned retirement date The date it's planned to retire the asset.
Retired to The vendor who is to receive the retired asset.
Retirement date

The date the asset was retired.

Available when: Close code is retired.
Retirement reason

Reason for retiring the asset.

Available when: Close code is retired.

User list

This section lists the end users who can access or use an asset. For example, you can list all persons who have access to an asset used for demonstrations, presentations, or other team activities.

The Share asset option applies if the asset is used by more than one person. If more than one person is added to the User list section, the Share asset option is automatically selected and isn't editable.

To add a linked record:

  1. Click Add or the grid icon .
  2. Select the record(s). The added items appear in yellow.
  3. Click Save.

To remove a linked record:

  1. Select the record(s).
  2. Click Remove. The selected items appear in strikethrough text.
  3. Click Save.

Attachments

Click Add attachment if you want to attach a file to the record.

Please note that

  • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.
  • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.
  • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

Finance tab

This tab has the following sections. 

Cost 

cost section
Field Description
Cost type The type of cost. For example, office supplies.
Cost center The business unit that the asset is charged to.

Acquisition

acquisition section
Field Description
Acquisition type The type of acquisition. For example, purchase or lease.
Acquisition date Date of the acquisition.
Acquisition end date Date the acquisition ends. For example, the end of the lease of the asset.
Total amount Amount paid to acquire the asset. If this is a batch asset, the total amount is automatically calculated from the quantity and unit price, and the field is read-only. To override this calculated value, clear the Unit price field, and then enter the desired total amount. Doing this disables the automatic calculation until you save the record.
Unit price

The unit price of the individual assets in batch assets. 

Available when: The Batch option is selected.
Currency Currency of the amount paid.
Tax rate (%) Applicable tax rate.
Payment terms When payment is contractually due.
Payment date Actual date of payment.
Receiving line The receiving line related to the asset.
Purchase order The purchase order related to the asset.
Invoice number Number of the invoice for the asset.

Resale

resale section
Field Description
Resale price Amount received on resale.
Resale date Date of resale.

Fixed assets

This section displays summary information about fixed asset records associated with this enterprise asset.

This section applies only when the acquisition type is Purchase or empty.

To display the selected fixed asset record, click the record identifier in the Id column.

You can add an association to a fixed asset record or remove an existing one from the record.

To add a linked record:

  1. Click Add or the grid icon .
  2. Select the record(s). The added items appear in yellow. 
  3. Click Save.

To remove a linked record:

  1. Select the record(s).
  2. Click Remove. The selected items appear in strikethrough text.
  3. Click Save.
